text: Pietro Frescobaldi (died 1654) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of San Miniato (1654). (in Latin) ==Biography== On 19 Oct 1654, Pietro Frescobaldi was appointed during the papacy of Pope Innocent X as Bishop of San Miniato. On 28 Oct 1654, he was consecrated bishop by Marcantonio Franciotti, Cardinal-Priest of Santa Maria della Pace, with Onorato Onorati, Bishop of Urbania e Sant'Angelo in Vado, and Vincenzo Candiotti, Bishop of Bagnoregio, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of San Miniato until his death on 11 Dec 1654. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Innocent X Category:1654 deaths
title: Pietro Frescobaldi
